TopicDetails.title: Innovation for healthy living and active ageing

programmeDivision.description: The European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT)

TopicDetails.conditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

The budget breakdown for this call is given in the call conditions section of the work programme. [,ADD hyprelink]:

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the General Work Programme.

    JTIs:
    described in part A of the Annex  of the BBI JU Annual Work Plan 2014.

    described in the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    described in part A of the Annexes of the ECSEL JU Work Plan 2014.

    described in part A of the General Annexes of the FCH2 JU Work Plan 2014.

    [Inducement Prizes]:
    described in part 8 of the Rules for Contests.

     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B and C of the General Annexes of the General Work Programme [, with the following exceptions]:

    The conditions specific to Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions (MSCA) are described in the MSCA section of the General Work Programme.

    The conditions specific to European Research Council (ERC) grants are described in the ERC Work Programme:
    Starting Grant, Consolidator Grant and Advanced Grant
    Proof of Concept Grant

    JTIs:
    described in part B of the Annex of the BBI JU Annual Work Plan 2014.

    described in the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    Admissibility conditions are described in part B of the Annexes of the ECSEL JU Work Plan 2014.
    Eligibility conditions are described in the ECSEL JU Work Plan 2014 under the heading “CALL ECSEL-2014-1 RIA – Eligibility Conditions”
    Eligibility conditions are described in the ECSEL JU Work Plan 2014 under the heading “CALL ECSEL-2014-2 IA – Eligibility Conditions”

    described in part B and C of the General Annexes of the FCH2 JU Work Plan 2014

    [Inducement Prizes]:
    Eligibility and exclusion criteria: described in part 8 of the Rules for Contests.

     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part H of the General Annexes of the General Work Programme [, with the following exceptions]:

    JTIs:
    described in part F of the Annex of the BBI JU Annual Work Plan 2014.

    described in the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    Part H of the Annexes of the ECSEL Work Plan 2014 describes the details of the evaluation and selection process
    The evaluation criteria, scoring and threshold are described in the ECSEL JU Work Plan 2014 under the heading “CALL ECSEL-2014-1 RIA – Evaluation criteria, scoring and threshold”
    The evaluation criteria, scoring and threshold are described in the ECSEL JU Work Plan 2014 under the heading “CALL ECSEL-2014-2 IA – Evaluation criteria, scoring and threshold”

    described in part E of the General Annexes of the FCH2 JU Work Plan 2014

    IMI JU:
    described in the evaluation form in section 6

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process

    The award criteria and evaluation procedure specific to Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions (MSCA) is described in the MSCA section of the General Work Programme.
    The evaluation criteria and procedure specific to European Research Council (ERC) grants is described in the ERC Work Programme:
    - Starting Grant, Consolidator Grant and Advanced Grant 
    - Proof of Concept Grant

    JTIs:
    BBI JU Calls 2014 - Guide for applicants

    Clean Sky 2 Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of calls for Core Partners

    ECSEL Calls 2014 – Guide for applicants

    FCH2 Guide for applicants on submission and evaluation

    IMI2 Manual for submission, evaluation and grant award

    [Inducement Prizes]:
    Evaluation and award criteria and procedure: described in part 3 of the Rules for Contests.


    3.3 Specific arrangements for the evaluation of Call [add Call ID]:
    [add the text describing specific arrangements, if applicable]

     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Information on the outcome of one-stage evaluation: maximum 5 months from the final date for submission.
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 3 months from the date of informing successful applicants.

    Information on the outcome of two-stage evaluation: maximum 5 months from the final date for submission.
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 3 months from the date of informing successful applicants.
     
    [ERC]:
    Information on the outcome of one stage (two-step) evaluation: For Step 2, maximum 8 months from the final date for submission.
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 9 months from the date of informing applicants.

    [Inducement Prizes]:
    Indicative timetable for evaluation and award of prizes:

  8. Open access must be granted to all scientific publications resulting from Horizon 2020 actions, and proposals must refer to measures envisaged. Where relevant, proposals should also provide information on how the participants will manage the research data generated and/or collected during the project, such as details on what types of data the project will generate, whether and how this data will be exploited or made accessible for verification and re-use, and how it will be curated and preserved.

[SESAR 2020]

The full information on this Call and the Technical Specifications for this Research Topic can be found in the SESAR 2020 Exploratory Research: First Call for Research Projects.

TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

ECSEL National Contact Points – consult Annex G of the ECSEL Work Plan 2014

IMI National Contact Points - IMI States Representative Group (SRG)

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk: Info-Call-CPW-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

ECSEL Helpdesk: setupecsel@ecsel.europa.eu

Contact CHAFEA Health Programme helpdesk for further assistance CHAFEA-HP-CALLS@ec.europa.eu

Contact CHAFEA Consumer Programme helpdesk for further assistance CHAFEA-CP-CALLS@ec.europa.eu

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

IMI JU IT Helpdesk

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

IMI Partner Search Tool helps you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant

RFCS Helpdesk: RTD-STEEL-COAL@ec.europa.eu – for assistance on RFCS rules for participation and submission of proposals, or for general questions on the RFCS programme.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate: The submission system will be available soon for 2014 topics opened on 11. December 2013. For 2014 topics with an opening date specified in the work programme, the submission system will be opened, at the earliest, on that date. For 2015 topics, no proposals can currently be submitted. The dates of opening of the submission system for 2015 topics will be provide later in 2014.
